content.raw:
It looks like the 'branches not getting closed' problem might be a bug in bitbucket:

https://bitbucket.org/site/master/issues/14116/mercurial-cross-fork-pullrequests-dont

Or possibly bitbucket just not having made up their mind yet about how this functionality was intended to work. The feature seems a little poorly thought out the way it presently works, to be honest, it's like they put it in to meet a specific use case (requests to merge branches that are actually in the same repo as each other, where everyone has commit access) at the cost of it confusing everyone who didn't have that specific use case.

The bug report was recent-ish (4 months) and initiated by bitbucket staff (edit: who no longer works there...), so maybe a decent chance of being resolved. I've left a comment prodding them and explaining our situation.
